hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on acceptance and willingness.

We’ll be doing a short introduction, followed by a meditation, time for reflection and then finally sharing our experiences.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. What brought you here today? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.
There is often a lot going on inside of us. Thoughts, feelings and sensations pop up without us having any control of their occurance.

Some things we tend to resist. Anxiety, worry, thoughts of death, fears of the future are common examples. When they show up, we may try to push them away. Think about something else. Distract ourselves.

But science tells us that the things we try to get rid of, have a tendency to come knocking over and over again. Welcoming those things with willingness and openness can be a smarter strategy in the long run. Let’s try it out.

> Press play to start the meditation

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

What was it like, taking a willing attitude towards your stressful thought? Did you notice any differences between the two occasions?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: How did you experience the willingness stance?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: How did you experience the willingness stance?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue with a mission for the rest of this day.

Whenever you notice you are resisting something on the inside, open up your willingness stance and try to instead welcoming that experience.

Science tells us that allowing difficult things on the inside may open up new possibilities to choose our actions and act for purpose.

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. How do you feel now, has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

en.name: The willingness stance

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: Guided meditation to stop fighting unwanted inner experiences and instead use our energy where it matters. Accepting inner hardships can help us redirect our focus and propel us into meaningful action.

hostNotes.text:
Sejam bem-vindos. Eu sou o/a X e hoje vamos dedicar cerca de 30 minutos à aceitação e predisposição.

Vamos fazer uma apresentação breve, seguida de uma meditação, tempo de reflexão e por fim vamos partilhar as nossas experiências uns com os outros.

Vamos começar com um mini check-in. O que te traz aqui hoje? Por favor, responde com duas ou três palavras. X, gostarias de começar?

> Permite que todos na sessão, inclusivé tu, façam um check-in individual.

Obrigada/o a todos pelo check-in. Vamos começar.
É comum termos muita coisa a acontecer dentro de nós. Pensamentos, emoções e sensações que aparecem sem termos qualquer controlo sobre a ocorrência das mesmas.

Tentamos resistir a algumas destas coisas. Ansiedade, preocupação, medo da morte, medos sobre o futuro são alguns exemplos comuns. Quando aparecem, podemos tentar afastá-los. Pensar sobre outra coisa. Distrairmo-nos.

Mas a ciência diz-nos que as coisas das quais nos queremos livrar tendem a persistir. Acolher essas coisas com boa vontade e abertura pode ser uma estratégia mais sensata a longo prazo. Vamos experimentar.

> Carrega no *play* para iniciar a meditação

Vamos reservar um minuto para refletirmos individualmente.

Como foi, ficar predisposto perante um pensamento stressante? Notaste alguma diferença entre as duas ocasiões?

Se quiseres, pode tomar notas no papel ou apenas notas mentais. E lembra-te que não há certos nem errados aqui. As tuas respostas são as tuas respostas. 1 minuto a partir de agora.

> Carrega no *play* para iniciar o cronómetro.

Ok, passou um minuto. Vamos continuar.

Agora vamos entrar na parte da partilha. E temos três regras para isso:

1. **O que é dito aqui, fica aqui.**
2. **Só precisas de ouvir.** Neste espaço não há necessidade de corrigir, ajudar ou dar conselhos. Estamos apenas a presenciar e a explorar o que nós e os outros estão a atravessar.

3. **Tudo no nosso interior é bem-vindo**. Raiva, amor, ódio, tristeza. O que quer que apareça. Não há certos nem errados. É o que é.

Teremos um temporizador de 2 minutos como referência. Se não quiseres partilhar podes dizer “passo”.

Quem quer começar?

> Deixa todos (tantos quantos possível dentro do tempo estipulado) partilharem, um de cada vez. Carrega *play* para iniciar o cronómetro. Reinicia o cronómetro para cada nova partilha.

Muito obrigada/o a todos.

Muito bem. Se estiveres com disposição, lançamos-te um desafio para o resto deste dia.

Sempre que te apercebas que estás a resistir a algo no teu interior, permite-te ficar predisposta/o e tenta em vez disso acolher essa experiência.

A ciência diz-nos que ao permitirmos sentir coisas desagradáveis no nosso interior, podemos abrir novas possibilidades de escolha face às nossas ações e agirmos com propósito.

Antes de sairmos deste espaço, vamos fazer um mini check-out. Como te sentes agora, mudou alguma coisa? Podes responder em duas ou três palavras.

Quem quer começar?

> Deixa todos os presentes fazerem o check-out individualmente.

Obrigada/o a todos por fazerem o check-out e estarem presentes hoje nesta sessão.

> Conclui a sessão para encaminhar os presentes para a experiência de saída.

pt.name: Estar Predisposta/o

hostNotes.text: > Começa a sessão quando estiveres pronta/o.

pt.description: Uma meditação guiada para parar a luta interior e canalizar a nossa energia para o que realmente importa. Aceitar os desafios internos pode ajudar-nos a redirecionar o nosso foco e impulsionar-nos para ações com significado.

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around <x> minutes on <theme of the session>

We’ll be doing <rough explanation of session - ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other>.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Now we’ll take <X minutes> to reflect on our own.

<Main question> <Further explanations of main question if needed>

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. <X minutes> starting now.

> Push play to start the timer.

That’s <X minutes> and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for <x minutes> as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Push play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

<mission description>

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.
> Start the session when you're ready to go
